Hi, I need your advice. I have 2 of the concept DEMV delivery capsule.

1. Lander platform with fuel tank , RCS , main engine , heat shield and etc. Rover mounted on top of it. Lander descends to the main engine on the planet with no atmosphere, and the parachute system on the planet with an atmosphere. After passage of the upper atmosphere, it resets the protection of overheating, and lands on the lander legs.

limitations -

big size , over 5m diameter (heavy)

accomplishments

-orientation for future patches (re-entry heat)

-the ability to raise the rover back into orbit at low gravity (with work docking) reusable

- large size allows to place additional tanks, and perhaps living module, it can be used for temporary housing on the surface (for example kethane factory)

- does not change the center of gravity of the rover

2. as Sky Crane

the unit is placed on top rover and has a small amount of fuel for the descent to the planet with a small force of gravity, or to assist in the descent to the parachute system.

limitations -

not reusable (undocked and forget )

changes the center of gravity of the rover, which does not allow him to move quickly on the surface

rover landing on wheels (jumps are possible suspension)

accomplishments-

small size and weight

possibly slow movement without undocking the machine
